name: Crown Hotel

reviews.text: My room had an awful heavy smell of smoke, just as if someone had smoked cigars the days before. A colleague travelling with me said his room also seemed to be a smoker's room. No alternative room was offered and the personnel seemed very surprised about my "discovery".
reviews.title: Just disappointing

reviews.text: Breakfast was simple and lacked variety.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE on the weekend!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet in my room was unstable and its speed was low.
reviews.title: staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This location is also a pub, which hosts live music in a courtyard which many of the rooms look out onto. After talking to the manager, it was very clear that don't feel this activity is mutually exclusive to providing a peaceful experience for tired travelers. Other aspects of this location are totally acceptable, but this decision and how my complaint was handled has made this stay a very regrettable decision.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

reviews.text: great stay allways found the girl working on reception called cat i think was very helpfull and pleasant . the room was clean and up to our expectations.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful hotel

reviews.text: My sister booked this hotel as we had a wedding nearby and I wasn't disappointed. Our drive there from Essex was terrible because of problems on the M25 but the bar staff were so nice that we relaxed immediately when we arrived. The bar is lovely and I must say the chips are divine!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a twin room which was huge with comfy beds and plenty of space for two vain women to get ready in a hurry. The bathroom was small-ish but clean. Our room overlooked the courtyard which I would be apprehensive about if we were staying in (it was a Saturday night) but we were out most of the night and didn't hear a thing when we got back.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough hotel...

reviews.text: The only small downside is that the area for breakfast was very cramped and it felt like I was forever moving my chair. The tables are also very small and already set up with lots of cutlery, preserves etc. so it was cramped and the staff weren't the fastest in the world at clearing empty plates or cups.
reviews.title: Decent stay at The Crown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were helpful though and one receptionist directed me to three shops when I wanted to pop out but on the flipside no one told us that we needed a code to exit the carpark so that was a fun five minutes. On the upside though the parking was ample which is good for a nervous driver like me.
reviews.title: excellent stay value for money

reviews.text: Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay here and would return.
reviews.title: Decent but choose carefully your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A brilliant base for visiting Ascot or Thorpe Park. We've stayed here a couple of times and found everything spot on. Situated in the heart of Chertsey, the check in procedure is smooth and the delicious buffet breakfasrt will set you up for the day. The young staff are friendly and efficient, the bar is characterful and on a hot summer evening, it's delightful to sit in the beer garden with a well-kept pint of real ale.........Recommended!
reviews.title: Ideal location and really good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I think the hotel was fine - good check in, comfortable & friendly atmosphere.
reviews.title: OK hotel, could be so much better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, it could be so much better with just a bit of attention to detail which it really lacks...
reviews.title: Good rooms for the money with a lovely pub attached.

reviews.text: We stayed here for one evening.... good bar, with football on a big screen in the garden where we had a quiet glass of wine. Dinner was OK - good selection on the menu (although several of the options not available)... but stale bread and fairly poor service as there were only two tables dining. Our main meals were actually good though. Breakfast was also quite disappointing, we found mould floating in our glasses of apple juice and there was a general layer of grime on everything - the table, cafetiere, sugar bowl etc.
reviews.title: Surprisingly quiet, air conditioning on a hot night much appreciated, good service!

reviews.text: During our stay we encountered a used sanitary towel in our hotel room bin (not ours!) and our room was just not particularly clean - could have done with a good hoover, layer of dust on the bathroom surfaces and so on.
reviews.title: Better than the low-average for his region

reviews.text: Nice, clean, comfortable rooms with good tea/coffee making facilities. Lovely courtyard / beer garden area. Nice food but drinks are overpriced. Judging by the comments on tripadvisor it appears that the majority of negative comments relate to the attitudes of the staff. I agree. They had no interest whatsoever. It's incredible that the hotel management is not taking on board comments of guests and addressing the one thing that brings this hotel down - the staff.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights with my family. Our lunchtime check-in was prompt and rooms were available immediately. Although rooms were spacious and clean, one of the rooms had a broken toilet seat and faulty kettle. This was reported to staff on two occasions who did nothing to rectify either problem.
reviews.title: Average hotel let down by staff

reviews.text: The biggest issue I had with this hotel was the indifference of staff. As with previous reviews of this hotel, the breakfast service left a lot to be desired. It was difficult to get a staff member to take a breakfast order in the first instance, they were more interested in chatting to each other in the lobby/reception area than attending to guests. Near-empty condiments, no butter or milk on table on either morning. I could have also done without the manager / owner's 3 Alsatian dogs running around.
reviews.title: Good standard, friendly staff, competitive room rate, though bar prices not cheap!

reviews.text: Average hotel let down by staff.
reviews.title: Crown Hotel in Chertsey, good but with some flaw

reviews.text: Stayed for one night on business. Friendly and efficient check in, there was some doubt over the readiness of the room I had been allocated, so this was immediately changed to one which was ready. Good standard room, with complimentary bottled water and good selection of toiletries. I went to the bar for a meal and before looking at the menu or wine list asked for a glass of red, deciding on a Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon after discussion with the bar staff. I should have checked the price more closely first - £9.20, even for a large glass, is a bit steep, even for Surrey! Food was good quality and a decent sized portion, perhaps a cut above standard pub grub, and served by friendly staff. Starters were priced at around £5 to 7, mains from around £10 to 20.
reviews.title: Terrible experience of a place to stay do not recommend at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked here as The Crown was No 1 hotel in Chertsey. Oh dear Chertsey. The hotel room was in serious need of some mod cons - such as heating. It was absolutely freezing. There was an old fasioned heater above the door which was not on before we arrived, which was a bit poor when the room is pre-booked. Anyhow, we pop the heater on and waited. After 48hours we can say the room was a little less than freezing. The hot water, was warm and to achieve that we ran to run the cold water tap in the sink! The room was also in serious need of redecoration. Thin sheets and stained cushions on the bed. Peeling paint in the bathroom and threadbare towels. The general smell of stale tobacco in the room and even on the shower curtain was less than appealing. To really get the room up to stratch perhaps the cleaners could remove the manky, cracked, discoloured old soap that had been left in the shower as we it was there when we arrived and probably still is!
reviews.title: Is this really the best Chertsey can offer?
Highlight of our trips to Chertsey!
reviews.text: We have stayed at the hotel many times while attending sporting events at TASIS. Always find the front staff attentive and helpful. They even gave us the tip to use the local Chertsey taxis when going back and forth to Heathrow, usually around 25 pounds instead of the 70 pounds charged by the black cabs. Very good English breakfast with all the trimmings. One of the reasons we like the hotel is that if you are very lucky and the weather is good they have an excellent patio out back. If you are not so lucky with the weather then there is always the pub with its dark panelling and comfy chairs. Fairly large menu with good fish and chips, nice cheddar chutney sandwiches, etc. Live music on Fridays. We prefer to stay in the main hotel part but have also stayed in the annex which is across the parking lot. Room are not fancy but clean and fairly large.
I had the honour of organising a hen weekend and we chose to go to Thorpe Park for the day so the Crown Hotel came up as being very close - only 5 mins in the car.
reviews.title: What a GREAT hotel

reviews.text: Prior to arriving the service from reservations was great, nothing was too much trouble. All the rooms were booked and confirmed really quickly. We got a great rate for B&B for two nights as we were part of a group.
reviews.title: Quality rooms and Thorpe park... 2mins 45sec away!

reviews.text: There was a live band playing the bar on Friday night which was an added extra. All the bar and restaurant staff were friendly and helpful even though they were busy with functions that weekend too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time staying in Chertsey, after a day spent at the nearby Thorpe Park. The hotel was very easy to get to, and they thankfully had their own private car-park tucked in behind the building, as there was none available out on the street. The staff were warm, friendly and welcoming. We were pleasantly delighted by the room. We stayed in room 214. The bed was a decent size. Everything was clean, and the room was really nicely furnished. The curtains were nice and darkening, meaning we were able to sleep through the sunrise without getting disturbed by light entering the room. The walls were thick and we could not hear our neighbours at all while we were in our room. The bathroom was fancy and clean, and had a plentiful supply of shampoos etc, and even a shower-cap. Wifi was freely available, high-speed, and easy to connect to, even in our room. Plenty of tv channels and great reception. Food was wonderful too. We ordered room-service for dinner, including a 'sharing platter' of wings, ribs, wedges, and corn and it was very delicious - especially the ribs. We also ordered the sausages and mash which was delightful - the sausages tasted amazing. The food came quickly. All in all, this was a very comfortable stay, and if we ever came back to Chertsey we would stay here again for sure. The only down-side for us (and why I did not give it a full 5-star rating) was that there appeared to be no elevator. We had a couple of large suitcases, as we were trekking around the UK, and we had to lug the suitcases up a flight of stairs in order to get to our room. But, having said that, the stairs were not too far - we are young and fit and were able to carry them up without difficulty. The corridors were perfectly wide to allow us to take our suitcases down to our room without difficulty. There's also no swimming pool at this hotel, but that's no big deal. If we were staying here for more than one night that might have been a negative point for us, but as it was we didn't have time for a swim anyway. Would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, would stay again

reviews.text: Spent one night but would stay for longer. Chosen for the area and also for being not too far from Gatwick airport. Staff were very helpful, cheerful and attentive. Bedroom was comfortable and the bathroom was roomy. The bar opens out onto the street but this doesn't detract. The breakfast was very enjoyable; good quality sausages and doorstep bread slices.
reviews.title: Good base good location

reviews.text: The facilities and hotel itself add up to 3 stars although the friendly nature of the staff and Tony, the manager, elevate the Crown to a 4 star experience. We were a large group and a special early buffet breakfast was quickly organised. I made a few small requests myself that were attended to immediatly. I will return without hesitation - Recommended!
reviews.title: Friendly Stay.

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded all our expectations. Lovely big room, nicely furnished and one of the biggest beds I've ever slept in, (we were in room 300) and very clean. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay again if I'm ever in the area.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is my 3rd stay at the crown and as yet have not been disappointed, great rooms both in the old part and the new part, breakfast was cooked to order, only 1 criticism was that my wife ordered a toasted sandwich for breakfast and the bread was only toasted on 1 side. staff were very friendly both on arrival and at all times through out the stay.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: Overall we had a good stay at the Crown.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and value for money, with a couple of niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pub has been recently refurbished and actually only fully re opened the week of our stay. Firstly, the positives; lovely room, spotlessly clean, roomy and modern. The staff were, in the main, very attentive and pleasant and the two bands we heard during our stay were very entertaining. The premises were well laid out and conducive to a good atmosphere, if I were to take on a pub the layout of the new Crown would be a blueprint for what I would want to achieve. We would stay there again as we did feel we had value for money.
reviews.title: Great Refurb

reviews.text: Now to the negatives; the price of a large Sauvignon Blanc £9.20!!.....I am a regular at The Ivy and they do not charge that price, really, the price of wine needs to be addressed, the mark up is very OTT. The food was OK, typical pub food, but nothing particularly exciting, indeed Bertha ( the name for the BBQ grill) seemed to have almost cremated the bottom of our hotel signature burgers...may I suggest they should be turned during the cooking process? The "chips" were actually potato wedges, barely deep fried and still in their skins, it is defying the Trades Descriptions Act to call them chips!!
reviews.title: Satisfied
Lovely hotel, great customer service
reviews.text: Today, as hotel guests, we were told we had to make sure that our cars were removed from the car park by 10am as they were having an event...now we felt that as a town centre pub that was a tad impertinent. Where were we expected to remove our cars too? We asked at Reception and the spaces at the front of the hotel were full, with the last space being taken by the member of staff that we spoke to...surely, if hotel guests were expected to park elsewhere staff should have been instructed to leave their cars at home and take public transport? I think that in such a location holding an event which places the car park out of action to paying hotel guests is a step too far. We also asked to close our bar tab the night before departure as we felt the details of our account had been compromised by being asked for name and room number within earshot of many other customers, this request was refused by the young chap with glasses, or rather, dismissed as inconsequential...it wasn't to us. I have no idea why he felt unable to accede to the request which seemed reasonable to us given that we were leaving the next morning, but, it was seemingly impossible. We left the bar wondering if we would face a huge tab run up by A. N Other at checkout, as it transpired we didn't, but we could have done. We felt our concerns were not taken seriously about this issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously stated, we would stay at the Crown again if only for the standard of the rooms, location, friendliness of Tony the Manager and the efficiency of the female staff, but, there are a few areas that need addressing to make the Crown a stand out destination for travellers close to London. Not least the fact the the convenience and satisfaction of guests in all areas should be at the forefront of any decisions taken. We felt that the event vis a vis car parking and hotel guests showed a lack of that and that was compounded by the issue with our bar tab. And again, the price of wine really does need addressing by Youngs who are seemingly the company in charge of the drinks prices.
reviews.title: What a fantastic place to stay!
Great pub hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here with my family for one night while visiting nearby Thorpe Park. The hotel had nice modern rooms including air conditioning, friendly staff and a good bathroom with a decent shower. The prices seemed reasonable for this area especially considering the quality of the rooms. Overall an ideal place to stop if visiting Thorpe Park.

Written on behalf of a colleague who stayed at the hotel last week. Her comments after staying at the crown echo what seems to be the common denominator looking through the reviews on here and what I learnt from my own experience last year.
reviews.title: Let down by poor service

reviews.text: The rooms at this place aren't too bad. Although a little hot, but with the current weather, could not be helped. The problem with this place is the staff (and the food!). Whether poor training or simply blind ignorance some are arrogant, others are unhelpful and the rest are too busy chatting to each other to care!!
reviews.title: Bad customer service

reviews.text: She ordered room service as she was on her own, by the time the food got to her, it was cold, and half was overcooked. We would both recommend eating out. Breakfast was no overly busy; with maybe 7 or 8 tables, but the food took an age to come, and when it did arrive, the poached eggs were virtually raw.
reviews.title: Love this traditional pub & accomodation
Great hot chocolate, outdoor seating and fish pond!
reviews.text: Overall, there are better places to stay locally, where the staff appreciate their guests and actually give a damn. If eating out is preferred, there are some quite nice local pubs or restaurants too.

description: We offer friendly, personal and unpretentious service, whether you're just in for a quiet pint, planning an intimate dinner, a stop-over for a business trip or staying for a leisurely weekend.If you want to stay in one of our 49 rooms, there are lots of leisurely attractions on our doorstep, we're well-placed for nearby Thorpe Park and you can't find a better overnight stopping off point if you're en route for an early business meeting in London.Welcome to your local.
